AWA.ConfirmDescription: Please use the Destiny 2 Companion App to approve DIM to modify your items.

Accounts.NoCharacters: You have no Destiny characters associated with this Bungie.net account. Try logging into a different account.
Accounts.ErrorLoading: Unable to load Destiny accounts from Bungie.net
Accounts.MissingDescription: The account you're trying to view is not an account linked to your Bungie.net profile.
Accounts.UnlinkTwitch: Linking your Twitch account to Bungie.net will cause your D1 accounts to stop working.
Accounts.ErrorLoadInventory: Unable to load your Destiny {{version}} characters and inventory
Accounts.ErrorLoadManifest: Unable to load Destiny info database from Bungie

AuditLog.Description: This log tracks all the changes you have stored in DIM Sync - including changes to settings, tags, and loadouts. After a while this log gets cleaned up.
AuditLog.TagCleanupUnknown: Cleaned up some tags for dismantled items
AuditLog.TagCleanup: Cleaned up {{count}} tag for dismantled items
AuditLog.TagCleanup_plural: Cleaned up {{count}} tags for dismantled items
AuditLog.SetTag: Set tag to {{tag}} for item ID {{id}}
AuditLog.SetNotes: Set notes to "{{notes}}" for item ID {{id}}

BungieService.DestinyLegacyPlatform: Bungie's services currently have a bug that prevents DIM from loading info for your Destiny 2 account if you played Destiny 1 on a last-gen console. Bungie will fix this soon, but until then you must play Destiny 1 on a current-gen console to be able to access your info.
BungieService.DevVersion: Are you running a development version of DIM? You must register your chrome extension with Bungie.net.
BungieService.ItemUniquenessExplanation: You tried to move the '{{name}}' {{type}} to your {{character}} but that destination already has that item and is only allowed one.
BungieService.ItemUniquenessExplanation_female: You tried to move the '{{name}}' {{type}} to your {{character}} but that destination already has that item and is only allowed one.
BungieService.ItemUniquenessExplanation_male: You tried to move the '{{name}}' {{type}} to your {{character}} but that destination already has that item and is only allowed one.
BungieService.Maintenance: Bungie.net servers are down for maintenance.
BungieService.NoAccount: No Destiny account was found. Do you have the right platform selected?
BungieService.NoAccountForPlatform: Failed to find a Destiny account for you on {{platform}}.
BungieService.NotConnected: You may not be connected to the internet.
BungieService.NotConnectedOrBlocked: You may not be connected to the internet, or an ad blocking or privacy extension may be blocking Bungie.net.
BungieService.NotLoggedIn: Please authorize DIM in order to use this app.
BungieService.SlowResponse: Bungie.net was too slow to respond.
BungieService.SlowDetails: Bungie.net is taking a long time to return your information. This can happen when a lot of players are in the game at once, or if Bungie.net is having issues. You also might be having an internet connection issue. We'll keep waiting for a response.
BungieService.Throttled: Bungie.net is limiting how many requests DIM can make.

Error.Archetype: Cannot compare this item as it is not a {{type}}.
Error.Class: Cannot compare this item as it is not for a {{class}}.

Csv.EmptyFile: There were no rows in the file.
Csv.ImportConfirm: Are you sure you want to import tags/notes from CSV? This will overwrite tags/notes for all items contained in your spreadsheet.
Csv.ImportFailed: Failed to import tags/notes from CSV: {{error}}
Csv.ImportWrongFileType: File is not a CSV file.

ErrorPanel.Description: This is likely an issue that affects all third-party apps. Check to see if Bungie.net loads, or the Destiny 2 Companion App works.

FarmingMode.D2Desc: DIM is preventing items from going to the Postmaster by making sure there's always one empty space per item type on {{store}}. It is moving items to the vault to make room.
FarmingMode.D2Desc_female: DIM is preventing items from going to the Postmaster by making sure there's always one empty space per item type on {{store}}. It is moving items to the vault to make room.
FarmingMode.D2Desc_male: DIM is preventing items from going to the Postmaster by making sure there's always one empty space per item type on {{store}}. It is moving items to the vault to make room.
FarmingMode.Desc: DIM is moving Engram and Glimmer items from {{store}} to the vault and leaving one space open per item type to prevent anything from going to the Postmaster.
FarmingMode.Desc_female: DIM is moving Engram and Glimmer items from {{store}} to the vault and leaving one space open per item type to prevent anything from going to the Postmaster.
FarmingMode.Desc_male: DIM is moving Engram and Glimmer items from {{store}} to the vault and leaving one space open per item type to prevent anything from going to the Postmaster.

MakeRoom.Desc: DIM is moving only Engram and Glimmer items from {{store}} to the vault or other characters to prevent anything from going to the Postmaster.
MakeRoom.Desc_female: DIM is moving only Engram and Glimmer items from {{store}} to the vault or other characters to prevent anything from going to the Postmaster.
MakeRoom.Desc_male: DIM is moving only Engram and Glimmer items from {{store}} to the vault or other characters to prevent anything from going to the Postmaster.
MakeRoom.MakeRoom: Make room to pick up items by moving equipment
MakeRoom.Tooltip: If checked, DIM will move weapons and armor around to make space in the vault for engrams.

FarmingMode.MoveTokens: Send reputation items to the vault
FarmingMode.OutOfRoom: You're out of space to move items off of {{character}}. Time to decrypt some engrams and clear out the trash!

Filter.AmmoType: Shows items based on their ammo type.
Filter.ArmorCategory: Shows armors based on their category.
Filter.Ascended: Shows items that have an ascend node which have been ascended.
Filter.Unascended: Shows items that have an ascend node which have not been ascended.
Filter.Breaker: Filter by breaker type or corresponding champion type.
Filter.Class: Shows items based on their class affinity.
Filter.Combine: Filters can be combined or grouped with parentheses, "or" and "and" to narrow down your search, for example "{{example}}".
Filter.ContributePower: Shows items that have power and can contribute to your power level.
Filter.Curated: Shows items that are a curated roll.
Filter.DamageType: Shows items based on their damage type.
Filter.DupeCount: Items that have the specificied number of duplicates.
Filter.DupeLower: Duplicate items, including reissues, that are not the highest power dupe.
Filter.Energy: Shows items that have energy capacity (Armor 2.0).
Filter.Equipped: Items that are currently equipped on a character.
Filter.Event: Shows items from which event in Destiny 2 they appeared in.
Filter.Glimmer: Shows items that are consumables that are related to gaining glimmer.
Filter.HasNotes: Show items that have notes applied.
Filter.HasShader: Shows items that have a shader applied.
Filter.HasOrnament: Shows items that have an ornament applied.
Filter.InLoadout: Shows items that are included in any loadout.
Filter.Infusable: Shows items that can be infused.
Filter.ItemId: Shows the item with the given inventory item ID. For advanced users.
Filter.ItemHash: Shows the items with the given inventory item hash. For advanced users.

Leveling.Complete: {{term}} - shows items that are totally complete - every upgrade unlocked.
Leveling.Incomplete: {{term}} - shows items that are not complete - there's still at least one upgrade to unlock.
Leveling.NeedsXP: {{term}} - shows items that can still have XP put into them.
Leveling.Upgraded: {{term}} - shows items that have enough XP to unlock all their nodes, but not all the nodes have been unlocked.
Leveling.XPComplete: {{term}} - shows items that cannot have XP put into them (whether or not their upgrades have been unlocked).

Filter.Location: Shows items based on their location within the app. left/middle/right are the visual location of the char, and while inleftchar will always work, the other two are based on how many characters you have. current is your last/current logged char (that is marked with a yellow triangle).
Filter.Locked: Shows items based on their locked status.
Filter.Masterwork: Shows items based on their masterwork stat or masterwork level.
Filter.MasterworkKills: Shows items based on their masterwork kill tracker count.
Filter.MaxPower: Shows the items which would maximize Power Level for each character class.

Mods.Y2: Shows items with a Year 2 mod attached.
Mods.Y3: Shows items with any Armor 2.0 mods selected.

Filter.ModSlot: Shows armor with a specific Seasonal Mod slot.
Filter.HoldsMod: Shows armor compatible with a specific type of Seasonal Mod.
Filter.NamedStat: Shows armor that has points in the named stat.
Filter.Negate: To negate a search, prefix that search term with a minus sign or the word "not", for example "{{notexample}}" or "{{notexample2}}".
Filter.Notes: Search for items that you have tagged with custom notes
Filter.Ornament: Shows items with ornaments and filters for their status.
Filter.PartialMatch: Shows items where their name, description, any perk, or any mod has a partial match to the filter text. Search for entire phrases using quotes. the 'perk:' filter will only search perks.
Filter.Perk: Shows items where one of their perks or mods has a partial match to the filter text in their name or description. Search for entire phrases using quotes.
Filter.PerkName: Shows items where one of their perks or mods has a partial match to the filter text in their name only. Search for entire phrases using quotes.
Filter.Postmaster: Items that are currently in the Postmaster.
Filter.PowerLevel: Shows items based on their power level.
Filter.PowerLimit: Shows items based on the maximum power level they can be infused to.
Filter.PowerfulReward: Shows pursuits which produce a powerful reward.
Filter.Quality: Shows items based on their total stat quality percentage. '{{percentage}}' is an alias for '{{quality}}'.
Filter.RandomRoll: Shows items that drop with random rolls.
Filter.RarityTier: Shows items based on their rarity tier.
Filter.Reacquirable: Shows items that can be reacquired from Collections.
Filter.Reforgeable: Shows items that can be reforged at the Gunsmith.
Filter.Cosmetic: Shows items that are flair or cosmetic.
Filter.RequiredLevel: Shows items based on their required level.
Filter.Season: Shows items from which season of Destiny 2 they appeared in.
Filter.SeasonalDupe: Shows duplicate items, not counting reissues from a different season as the same item.
Filter.StackLevel: Shows items based on the quantity of items in its stack.
Filter.Stackable: Shows items that can stack (ammo synths, strange coin, etc)
Filter.Stats: Shows items based on a specific stat value.
Filter.StatsBase: Filters armor based on its base stat value, not including attached mods or masterworking.
Filter.StatsLoadout: Finds a set of items to equip for the maximum total value of a specific stat.
Filter.StatsMax: Finds armor with the highest number for a specific stat. Includes all items with the highest stat.
Filter.SunsetAfter: Shows items based on the last season they can reach the Seasonal Power Cap.

Tags.Tag: Shows items that have a specific tag.
Tags.Tagged: Shows items that have any tag.

Filter.Tracked: Shows quests/bounties based on their tracked status.
Filter.Transferable: Items that can be moved between characters.
Filter.Trashlist: Shows items that match your wish list's trash list.
Filter.Vendor: Item is available from a specific vendor.
Filter.WeaponType: Shows weapons based on their weapon type.
Filter.Wishlist: Shows items that match your wish list.
Filter.WishlistDupe: Shows duplicate items where at least one of the duplicates is on your wish list.
Filter.WishlistNotes: Shows wish listed items whose notes match the search.
Filter.Year: Shows items from which year of Destiny they appeared in.

Header.IosPwaPrompt: In Mobile Safari, click the share icon (middle button on the bottom) and select "Add to Home Screen".

Help.CannotMove: Cannot move that item off this character.
Help.Drag: Hold shift to transfer a partial stack
Help.NoStorageMessage: DIM can't store data in your browser. This can be caused by browsing in private or incognito mode, or when you have low disk space. You won't be able to log in to or use DIM.

Infusion.NoTransfer:
Transfer infusion material
 {{target}} cannot be moved.

ItemMove.Distributed:
Distributed {{name}}
 {{name}} is now equally divided between characters.
ItemMove.ToVault: All {{name}} are now in your vault.

BucketFull.Guardian: There are too many '{{itemtype}}' items on your {{store}}.
BucketFull.Guardian_female: There are too many '{{itemtype}}' items on your {{store}}.
BucketFull.Guardian_male: There are too many '{{itemtype}}' items on your {{store}}.
BucketFull.Vault: There are too many '{{itemtype}}' items in the {{store}}.

ItemService.Classified: This item is classified and cannot be transferred at this time.
ItemService.Classified2: Classified item. Bungie does not yet provide information about this item. Add notes to this item and use the "notes:" search filter to find it.
ItemService.Deequip: Cannot find another item to equip in order to deequip {{itemname}}
ItemService.ExoticError: '{{itemname}}' cannot be equipped because the exotic in the {{slot}} slot cannot be unequipped. ({{error}})
ItemService.NotEnoughRoom: There's nothing we can move out of {{store}} to make room for {{itemname}}
ItemService.OnlyEquippedClassLevel: This can only be equipped on a {{class}} at or above level {{level}}.
ItemService.OnlyEquippedLevel: This can only be equipped on characters at or above level {{level}}.
ItemService.StackFull: You already have a full stack of {{name}}
ItemService.TooMuch: Looks like you requested to move more of this item than exists in the source!

LB.ExcludeHelp: Shift + click an item (or drag and drop into this bucket) to build sets without specific gear.

Help.And: Armor with all of these perks will be used ("and")
Help.ChangeNodes: Change the Intellect, Discipline, or Strength nodes in game to what is displayed to create each loadout.
Help.Discipline: Discipline speeds up Grenade recharge time
Help.DragAndDrop: Drag and drop items into the locked buckets to build sets with only that gear
Help.Intellect: Intellect speeds up Super recharge time
Help.Lock: Lock a set of perks by clicking a lock bucket and selecting perks
Help.MultiPerk: To use armor with multiple perks together shift+click the desired perks
Help.NoPerk: If a perk doesn't appear it means that you own no armor with that perk
Help.Or: Armor with any of these perks will be used ("or")
Help.ShiftClick: Shift click an item to build sets without that gear
Help.StatsIncrease: As an items defense level increases, the stats on that item (int/dis/str) also increase.
Help.Strength: Strength speeds up Melee recharge time
Help.Synergy: Try to find armor that has ammo increasing perks for weapon types that you use.
Help.Tier11Example: 4/5/2 (a Tier 11 build) is 4 Intellect, 5 Discipline, 2 Strength (4+5+2 = Tier 11)

LightMode.HelpCurrent: Calculates loadouts at current defense levels.
LightMode.HelpScaled: Calculates loadouts as if all items were 350 defense.

LB.LockedHelp: Drag and drop any item into its bucket to build set with that specific gear. Shift + click to exclude items.
LB.Missing2: Missing rare, legendary, or exotic pieces to build a full set!

ProcessingMode.HelpFast: Only looks at your best gear.
ProcessingMode.HelpFull: Looks at more gear, but takes longer.

LoadoutBuilder.AltPerkKey: Choose this perk to get the stats displayed
LoadoutBuilder.AssumeMasterworkDetailed: Generate sets assuming all items are masterworked.
LoadoutBuilder.BadPerk: A perk that "slightly" modifies isn't the best option.
LoadoutBuilder.ChooseAlternate: Choose another item with the same stats:
LoadoutBuilder.IgnoreAffinityDetailed: Ignore element affinity when selecting mods.
LoadoutBuilder.ItemsGroupedByStats: Singular items have been grouped by stats and masterwork status.
LoadoutBuilder.ItemsGroupedByStatsEnergy: Singular items have been grouped by stats, masterwork status and energy type.
LoadoutBuilder.ItemsGroupedByStatsEnergyModSlot: Singular items have been grouped by stats, masterwork status, energy type and the seasonal mod slot.
LoadoutBuilder.ItemsGroupedByStatsModSlot: Singular items have been grouped by stats, masterwork status and the seasonal mod slot.
LoadoutBuilder.LimitedCombos: You have {{combosWithoutCaps, number}} possible combinations, but we only looked at {{combos, number}} of them to keep DIM from crashing. As a result, some possibilities are not shown. Lock some items or perks or dismantle some old armor to get under the limit. Locking general or seasonal mods increases the number of combinations.
LoadoutBuilder.NoBuildsFound: No builds found. Try expanding your filtering criteria.
LoadoutBuilder.NoBuildsFoundWithReasons: No builds found. Common causes of this include:
LoadoutBuilder.NoBuildsFoundExoticsAndMods: You have an exotic and five seasonal mods locked.
LoadoutBuilder.NoBuildsFoundModsAreTooExpensive: The selected mods' energy requirements are too high.
LoadoutBuilder.NoBuildsFoundSeasonalModNotSatisfied: You are missing an item to hold one of the selected seasonal mods.
LoadoutBuilder.NoComparableItems: This loadout has no comparable items. Saving the Optimizer Set will add the items to this loadout.
LoadoutBuilder.OptimizerExplanation: Select perks, filter and reorder stats, and lock items to narrow down your potential loadouts.
LoadoutBuilder.OptimizerExplanationDesktop: Shift-click a perk to select it. Shift-click an item to exclude it. Drag items to the sidebar to exclude or lock them.
LoadoutBuilder.OptimizerExplanationArmour2Mods: Stat changes from Armor 2.0 Mods are excluded where possible, for more info please see {{link}}.
LoadoutBuilder.SelectMaxEnergyDescription: Sets a maximum energy amount to ignore (so you can choose how much you're willing to spend on changing armor element).
LoadoutBuilder.SelectMinStatTotalDescription: Sets the minimum stat total for a single armor piece (excluding class items).
LoadoutBuilder.SelectPowerDescription: Sets a minimum power level for the entire loadout (not individual pieces)
LoadoutBuilder.StatIncorrectWarning:
To get accurate results, please remove any mods with negative or conditional stat effects.

Due to mods with negative stat modifiers or conditional stat effects, DIM cannot determine the base value of {{stats}} on some included items. This is a limitation of the information sent by Bungie.net.
LoadoutBuilder.TheseModsCouldNotBeAssigned: These mods could not be assigned to the existing loadout.
LoadoutBuilder.YouTubeLink: Watch a tutorial about Loadout Optimizer on YouTube.

Loadouts.Abandon: Are you sure you want to abandon this loadout?
Loadouts.AlreadyExistsClass: A loadout with this name already exists for your {{className}}.
Loadouts.AlreadyExistsGlobal: A global loadout with this name already exists.
Loadouts.AppliedError: None of the items in your loadout could be transferred.
Loadouts.AppliedWarn: Your loadout has been partially transferred, but {{failed}} of {{total}} items had errors.
Loadouts.Classified: Some of your items are classified, and cannot be included in the max power calculation.
Loadouts.ConfirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete '{{name}}'?
Loadouts.EquippableDifferent1: Multiple Exotic items were used to calculate your Maximum Power, so the number shown may not be achievable when equipping your items in-game.
Loadouts.EquippableDifferent2: Maximum Power isn't limited by the "One Exotic" rule when determining the Power of your drops/powerfuls/pinnacle rewards.
Loadouts.MakeRoomDone: Finished making room for 1 Postmaster item by moving 1 item off of {{store}}.
Loadouts.MakeRoomDone_female: Finished making room for 1 Postmaster item by moving 1 item off of {{store}}.
Loadouts.MakeRoomDone_male: Finished making room for 1 Postmaster item by moving 1 item off of {{store}}.
Loadouts.MakeRoomDone_plural: Finished making room for {{count}} Postmaster items by moving {{movedNum}} items off of {{store}}.
Loadouts.MakeRoomDone_female_plural: Finished making room for {{count}} Postmaster items by moving {{movedNum}} items off of {{store}}.
Loadouts.MakeRoomDone_male_plural: Finished making room for {{count}} Postmaster items by moving {{movedNum}} items off of {{store}}.
Loadouts.MakeRoomError: Unable to make room for all Postmaster items: {{error}}.
Loadouts.MaxSlots: You can only have {{slots}} of that kind of item in a loadout.
Loadouts.NoEngrams: No non-exotic engrams are available to transfer.
Loadouts.NoExotics: No engrams are available to transfer.
Loadouts.NotificationMessage: Sending loadout with 1 item to vault.
Loadouts.NoTokens: No reputation items are available to transfer.
Loadouts.OnlyItems: Only equippable items, materials, and consumables can be added to a loadout.
Loadouts.RandomizePrompt: Randomize your equipped class, weapons, armor and ghost?
Loadouts.RandomizeSearchPrompt: Randomize your equipped items from search "{{query}}"?
Loadouts.RandomizeWeapons: Randomize your equipped class and weapons?
Loadouts.TooManyRequested: You have {{total}} {{itemname}} but your loadout asks for {{requested}}. We transferred all you had.
Loadouts.VendorsCannotEquip: You don't have these items. Tap to pick a replacement or click the X to remove:

Manifest.Download: Downloading latest Destiny info database from Bungie...
Manifest.OutdatedExplanation: Bungie has updated their Destiny info database. Reload DIM to pick up the new info. Note that some things in DIM may not work for a few hours after Bungie updates Destiny, as the new data propagates through their systems.

MoveAmount.DownStack: Decrease down to the next full stack
MoveAmount.UpStack: Increase up to the next full stack

MovePopup.Acquired: This item is unlocked in collections.
MovePopup.AcquiredMod: This mod is currently applied to an item in your inventory.
MovePopup.CantPullFromPostmaster: You must go to the tower to retrieve this item.
MovePopup.MissingSockets: Perk and mod details are unavailable while Bungie is updating their services. It will return when they are done, usually in a few hours.
MovePopup.Owned: This item is in your inventory.
MovePopup.OwnedMod: This mod is in your modifications inventory.

Organizer.ShiftTip: Tip: Hold the Shift key and click on a cell to filter items
Organizer.NoMobile: Turn your phone sideways to use the Organizer.

Progress.NoTrackedTriumph: You have no tracked triumphs. Track one in the game, or as many as you like in DIM.

SearchHistory.Description: These are all your past and saved searches. You can delete them from here.

Settings.CustomStatDesc: Choose armor stats to make a custom total stat that will show on the item popup, Organizer, and Compare. Search with stat:custom:>=30.
Settings.DefaultItemSizeNote: An item size of 50px will look the sharpest, without blurring the item picture or text.
Settings.DontForgetDupes: Don't forget you can search is:dupe to quickly find duplicate items, and you can use the comparison tool to evaluate related items.
Settings.EnableAdvancedStats: Show stat quality rating on armor (D1)
Settings.ExportSSHelp: Download a CSV list of your items that can be easily viewed in the spreadsheet app of your choice.
Settings.ExportSSNoStores: You need to load your inventory once before clicking this button.
Settings.InventoryColumnsMobile: Character inventory width on mobile portrait
Settings.InventoryColumnsMobileLine2: The items will be resized to accommodate the new setting
Settings.ReloadDIM: Reload DIM to finish switching language
Settings.ShowNewItems: Indicate new items with a red dot

Stats.CustomDesc: Custom total of selected base stats, ignoring mods or masterworks. Visit Settings to configure which stats are included.
Stats.PowerModifier: Power granted by seasonal experience progression
Stats.PercentHelp: Click for more information about what Stats Quality is.
Stats.PowerCapDisclaimer: Power Limit information may be incorrect for armor from any raid, or weapons from the raids "Last Wish" and "Garden of Salvation."
Stats.Prestige:
Prestige Level: {{level}}
{{exp}}xp until 5 motes of light.
Stats.PrestigeD2:
Prestige Level: {{level}}
{{exp}}xp until a bright engram.
Stats.TotalIncorrectWarning: Due to mods with negative or conditional stat effects, DIM cannot determine the base value of {{stats}}. This is a limitation of the information sent by Bungie.net.

ApiPermissionPrompt.Title: Enable DIM Sync?
ApiPermissionPrompt.Description: DIM can now store your tags, loadouts, and settings on our own servers and sync that data between different versions of DIM, with no separate login. You can import your existing data from the Settings page if you haven't enabled DIM Sync before. This was made possible by the support of our OpenCollective backers!

Storage.AutoBackup: We've backed up your data to a file in your downloads folder called dim-data.json, just in case.
Storage.BackUpFirst: You MUST back up your data first, before you delete it all. Just in case.
Storage.BrowserMayClearData: The browser may delete this information if you run out of space or don't visit DIM frequently.
Storage.DeleteAllData: Delete ALL Data from DIM Sync Servers
Storage.DeleteAllDataConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete ALL your data, for all accounts, from DIM Sync? You can't undo this.

Details.IndexedDBStorage: Local storage will save your information only on this browser. Clearing your browsing data will delete this information.

Storage.DimApiFinePrint: DIM will save your tags, loadouts, and settings to the DIM servers and sync them between different versions of DIM.
Storage.ImportConfirmDimApi: Are you sure you want to overwrite your current tags, loadouts, and settings with this version? It will completely replace what you had.

ImportNotification.SuccessBodyForced: Imported settings, {{loadouts}} loadouts, and {{tags}} tagged items from your backup into DIM Sync, replacing what was already there.
ImportNotification.SuccessBodyLocal: Imported settings, {{loadouts}} loadouts, and {{tags}} tagged items from your backup into local storage, replacing what was already there. We cannot guarantee that local storage won't be lost - consider enabling DIM Sync.
ImportNotification.NoData: No loadouts or tags found in the backup

Storage.ImportTooManyFiles: Please only select one file to import.
Storage.ImportWrongFileType: File is not a JSON file. It may not be a DIM backup.
Storage.ProfileErrorBody: We had a problem loading your DIM Sync data
Storage.UpdateErrorBody: We had a problem saving your data to DIM Sync
Storage.Usage: DIM is using {{usage, humanBytes}} out of {{quota, humanBytes}} available to it on this device. This includes the downloaded Destiny item databases from Bungie.net.

VendorEngramsXyz.DroppingHigh: VendorEngrams.xyz reports that this vendor is dropping high-level items.
VendorEngramsXyz.Vote: Seeing a vendor selling items near your light level? Go to VendorEngrams.xyz to vote and let the community know!

About.APIHistory: View the history of all actions taken by DIM (and other Destiny apps)
About.BungieCopyright: All images and content are property of Bungie.
About.DiscordHelp: Ask questions, give feedback, and get support in our Discord channels.
About.FAQAccess: How does DIM get access to my Destiny data?
About.FAQAccessAnswer: We use Bungie's app authentication to grant access to DIM to see and move your items. DIM never sees your username or password. This is the same way the Companion app works.
About.FAQKeyboardAnswer: Yes! Press "?" to see a list of available shortcuts.
About.FAQLogout: How can I log out of DIM?
About.FAQLogoutAnswer: Open the menu from the top left icon and choose "Log Out"
About.FAQLostItem: I lost my item using your tool!
About.FAQLostItemAnswer: Bungie doesn't allow apps to delete items (even their own app!). More than likely a transfer failed, leaving your item in the vault or on another character. You could search for the item. If that doesn't turn it up, reload the page. Check {{link}} or in game to see if your item still exists. We're sure it's still there.
About.FAQMobile: Does DIM support mobile? Will there be an app?
About.FAQMobileAnswer: The DIM website can be loaded on phones and tablets today, and you can add it to your home screen for an app-like experience.
About.GitHubHelp: If you're interested in contributing to the project, visit us at our project page on {{link}}.
About.HowItsMade: DIM is a free, open source app built by community developers upon the same services used by Bungie.net and the Destiny Companion App.
About.RedditHelp: If you have questions, comments, or suggestions - let us know!

Schedule.beta: This beta version of DIM is updated every time we change the code - it gets the latest features and fixes, but also the latest bugs!
Schedule.release: This version of DIM is updated once a week, at approximately midnight on Sundays, US Pacific time.

About.TranslationText: We use {{link}} for ease of translation. If you want to improve one of DIM's translations, join the team.
About.TwitterHelp: Be sure to follow us to stay on top of updates and real time application state information.
About.YouTubeHelp: Learn how to use DIM on our YouTube channel.
About.WikiHelp: Learn how to use DIM and contribute to our community-driven user guide.

Login.Explanation: Allow DIM to view and modify your Destiny characters, vault, and progression.
Login.LearnMore: Do you want to know more?
Login.NewAccount: Log in with a different account
Login.UpgradeExplanation: Home screen apps on your version of iOS don't allow you to log in to DIM. Please upgrade to iOS 12.2 or newer and re-add DIM to your home screen.

Support.BackersDetail: Support us with a one-time or monthly donation and help us continue our active development.
Support.FreeToDownload: DIM is a product that is free to download and use. The source code for DIM is open source and free for anyone to enhance. You will never see an ad in DIM. That is our commitment.
Support.OpenCollective: We are using {{link}} as a service to provide compensation to our developers for their dedication and time spent on this project.
Support.Store: We have merch with our logo and other designs for sale on {{link}}

WishListRoll.BestRatedTip: This perk exactly matches a weapon roll on your wishlist.
WishListRoll.BestRatedTip_plural: These perks exactly match a weapon roll on your wishlist.
WishListRoll.ExternalSource: Optionally, supply the URL for a wish list
WishListRoll.ImportSuccess: Wish list loaded with information about one roll.{{titleAndDescription}}
